title: Mbappé Signs for Real Club
article: Kylian Mbappé has signed for Real Club, joining the European champions after a record-breaking season with Paris Saint-Germain, where he scored 44 goals. At 25, Mbappé has consistently topped the French league scoring charts for six seasons and is PSG's all-time leading scorer with 256 goals. His accolades include winning the World Cup in 2018 and the Nations League in 2021 with the French national team, where he serves as captain. Mbappé also claimed the Golden Boot at the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. Throughout his career, he has been included multiple times in the FIFA FIFPro World 11 and the UEFA Champions League team of the season, and has been recognized as the best player in the French championship on five occasions. Before PSG, Mbappé began his career at Monaco, where he won his first French league title and made his Champions League debut. His honors include 1 World Cup, 1 Nations League, 7 French Leagues, 4 French Cups, 5 French Super Cups, 2 League Cups, and 1 European Under-19 Championship.
